channel.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
channel.description:
I've been looking forward to this for a while, looks like a good one day event for electronic music in Bristol.
https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1179017

item.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

There must be a way but I havenâ€™t figured it out yet. You can chain 8 of the 16 step sequences as far as I can tell, and each sequence can simultanously control 8 voices. That seems a bit limiting to me, but I might be missing something. Also there is the potential for future firmware upgrades, I guess the limit will be the available memory they have installed in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Is there really no way to chain sequences?

That is a bummer.

item.source: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?

item.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

Yep, thats what I haven't figured out, how to get the longer sequences. It seems one is limited by it, you can't just assign a sequence to a pad as with a clip launcher. So anyway I got beatmaker 3 on the iPad and I will probably use that for clip launching.

The Novation has a lot of modes and I haven't had the time to really grok how to use them all together.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?

item.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

I am sure you will get some nice stuff out of it. I just saw the Bobeats video. It definitely got a lot of features. Love the scaling/filter feature for key input, the key splitting, where you can play split the keyboard up so you have access to several instruments at the same time. Not sure how it works with playing more sequences one after another, to create longer sequences. Thats kind of important thing too. But overall it looks like a pretty need tool

About sequencers one of the companies that makes decent sequencers is Elektron. They are pretty cool.

I had both an Octatrack and a Digitakt, both were pretty decent

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?

item.title: Anyone for Machina Bristonica, Bristol UK?
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

Yes I did, the youtubes don't go far enough and probably I just have to spend more time with the manual.

The sequencer is a bit more limited than I hoped, but the ability to control various instrument parameters is really great.

Read full topic
